oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Magnetic properties of magnetite thin films close to the Verwey transition
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BOHRA, M
PRASAD, S
VENKETARAMANI, N
KUMAR, N
SAHOO, SC
KRISHNAN, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fe3o4 films
behavior
target
verwey transition
magnetization
magnetite
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Temperature dependence of the magnetic properties of magnetite thin film across the Verwey transition has been investigated. As the temperature is decreased, the magnetization of the film in a fixed field showed a sharp decrease close to the Verwey transition temperature (T(v)). The M-H loops of the film have been recorded at various temperatures below and above T(v). It is found that film does no saturate at any temperature and saturation becomes more difficult below T(v). While cooling through T(v), the extrapolated value of magnetization to infinite field (Q), calculated from the numerical fit 4 pi M = Q [1-(H*/H)(1/2)], does not show a drop, but the coefficient indicating difficulty in saturation (H*) shows a sharp rise as does the coercivity. (C) 2009
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS, 321(22), 3738-3741
